qas.question: When did the FBI increase it's counter-terrorism role?
What prompted the FBI increase in counter-terrorism?
Where was the World Trade Center?
What did agents within the FBI do to investigations of the agency?
What role did the FBI focus more on before 1993?
When did the second World Trade Center bombing occur?
What stopped the FBI from ensuring that these three cases were successfully prosecuted?
During what Olympics was the FBI praised for its investigation?

context: <a0_0>Between 1993 and 1996<a0_0/>, the FBI increased its <b5_0>counter-terrorism<b5_0/> role in the wake of the first <b6_0>1993<b6_0/> <a1_0>World Trade Center bombing<a1_0/> in <a2_0>New York City, New York<a2_0/>; the <a3_0>1995<a3_0/> Oklahoma City bombing in Oklahoma City, Oklahoma; and the arrest of <b7_0>the Unabomber<b7_0/> in 1996. <b8_0>Technological innovation<b8_0/> and the skills of FBI Laboratory analysts helped ensure that the three cases were successfully prosecuted. Justice Department investigations into the FBI's roles in the Ruby Ridge and Waco incidents were found to be <a4_0>obstructed<a4_0/> by agents within the Bureau. During the <b9_0>1996 Summer Olympics<b9_0/> in Atlanta, Georgia, the FBI was criticized for its investigation of the Centennial Olympic Park bombing. It has settled a dispute with Richard Jewell, who was a private security guard at the venue, along with some media organizations, in regard to the leaking of his name during the investigation.
